ai-mil3.1.5:1.1_0: He then went to the royal palace and sat down on the seat spread out.
ai-mil3.1.5:1.2_0: Once again Migāra’s mother served and satisfied Venerable Dhanañjāni with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods. Then he clothed the lay followers on the other, saying,
ai-mil3.1.5:1.3_0: “Venerable Sir, you were sitting together with the monks, for ten reasons.”
ai-mil3.1.5:2.1_0: When he had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Migāra’s hands bowl, sat down to one side, and said to him:
ai-mil3.1.5:2.2_0: “Reverend Sir, what is the talk about with dragons?”
ai-mil3.1.5:2.3_0: “Because we want to have a discussion about this.”
ai-mil3.1.5:3.2_0: “Sir, what’s your going forth? What’s yours yours? What’s yours?”
ai-mil3.1.5:3.4_0: “How, great king, does that suffering cease and not arise for someone else? And what does it arise?
ai-mil3.1.5:3.5_0: There is this purpose, great king, that going forth is my ultimate extinguishment by not grasping.”
ai-mil3.1.5:4.1_0: “But sir, are all having gone forth for refuge from the Buddha?”
ai-mil3.1.5:4.2_0: “Great king, some gods who have gone forth as a ruler who have gone forth into homelessness not, because of which they have gone forth as a criminal for which people in order to go forth.”
ai-mil3.1.5:5.1_0: “But sir, do you have gone forth for refuge?”
ai-mil3.1.5:5.2_0: “I don’t know that there was a youth, but I don’t recall having gone forth. But I don’t want to train in this way.”
ai-mil3.1.5:7.1_0: the fifth enquiry, (but) the fifth Question,
